result.markdown: --- title: "Nonparametric tests and count data" --- ## Content - Nonparametric tests - Models and tests for count data ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - Understand the benefits and drawback of rank-based tests - Perform tests for count data (Fisher exact test, $\chi^2$ tests) and correctly report their output with effect sizes ## Readings - {{< fa book >}}[Chapter 12 *Categorical data analysis*](https://learningstatisticswithr.com/book/chisquare.html) of @Navarro:2019 - [Chapter 12](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/nonparametric-tests.html) of the course notes ## Slides :::{.callout-tip} **Fun fact**: If you type ? (or shift + /) while going through the slides, you can see a list of slide-specific commands. :::
